metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1716 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Runtime_SetPrototype function in runtime.cc in Google V8, as used in Google Chrome before 34.0.1847.116, allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified vectors, aka "Universal XSS (UXSS)."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1716` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-browser-l10n - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-chromedriver - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: chrisccoulson> Issue was fixed prior to Oxide r501, the first version to be included in an Ubuntu release mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '34.0.1847.116-0ubuntu2').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
